are-you-sure-you-want-to-discard-changes: Are you sure you want to discard unsaved changes?
authors-block-description: Authors block is use to display brief bio and photo of author(s) of a specific page
back-card-explanation: This card is used as the back side of a flip card
background-image-xlarge: Background image (extra large screens and above)
chapter-locking-enabled-notice: Chapter locking is enabled for this course. Students must complete chapters in order.
chapter-progress-placeholder-explanation: This block is used to display Chapter progress. To display the whole course progress, you should use the Course Progress block.
chapters-grid-placeholder-explanation: This block is placed on the course material front page for navigating to different chapters easily.
chatbot-block-placeholder-explanation: A chatbot that's placed within the material. Cannot be the same chatbot as the default chatbot of the course. The default chatbot is accessible on all course pages from the button in the lower right corner.
code-giveaway-explanation: This block indicates where a code giveaway is located in the course material.
conditional-block-explanation: This block will be shown to the student if the student meets all the given conditions.
congratulations-explanation: This block is placed in the course material where you wish to show the student congratulations when they have completed the course. For courses that have been configured for receiving ECTS, it will also provide a link to a page where they can register their completion to Open University.
course-instance-enrollment-condition: Student has enrolled to any of the following course instances:
course-progress-placeholder-explanation: This block is placed on the course material where you wish to show to the user their current progress and how many points they have gotten from the whole course.
email-subject-helper-text: The subject line that will be used when sending emails using this template.
error-cannot-render-editor-for-exercise-: Cannot render editor for exercise service {{slug}}.
error-cannot-render-exercise-task-missin: Cannot render exercise task, missing url.
exercise-custom-view-block-explanation: A view to an exercise service that is not related to an exercise.
exercises-in-chapter-placeholder-explana: This block is placed on each chapter front page, e.g. /chapter-1/ for listing and navigating to different exercises within chapter.
expandable-content-explanation: This block has one or multiple headers and each have content that can be expanded/collapsed
flip-card-placeholder-explanation: This block is used to display a two-sided flippable card.
front-card-explanation: This card is used as the front side of a flip card
glossary-placeholder-explanation: This block will contain the glossary of the course.
label-chapter-locking-enabled-descriptio: When enabled, all chapters in the course are locked by default. Students must complete chapters in order to unlock subsequent chapters.
label-exercises-done-through-locking-des: When enabled, exercises in this chapter require manual review after locking. Students will not receive points until the chapter is locked and teacher reviews their answers.
label-reset-answer-if-zero: Automatically reset the answer if the review results in zero points
lock-chapter-block-description: Button for students to lock chapter (mark as done).
lock-chapter-editor-description: This block displays a button that allows students to lock a chapter, marking it as completed. When a student locks the chapter, the content you add below will be displayed to them.
lock-chapter-inner-blocks-help: Add content here that will be shown to students after they lock this chapter. This is perfect for model solutions, additional resources, or congratulatory messages.
lock-chapter-placeholder-explanation: This block is used to display a button for students to lock a chapter (mark as done).
map-block-placeholder-explanation: This is a placeholder for a map that shows countries of student enrolled in a course.
menti-height-help-text: Height in pixels. Adjust the height of the embedded window so that the scrollbar disappears. Also make sure that the scrollbar is not visible in the course material.
menti-panel-instructions: Please paste the URL to embed and submit. After that you can define the title and height.
menti-title-help-text: Set a title. This is used by screen readers.
module-completion-condition: Student has completed any of the following modules:
no-chatbots-for-course: This course has no chatbots configured. Configure them in the course management page. Please note that you cannot add the course default chatbot here.
no-placeholders-detected: No placeholders detected in the email content. Make sure to include the required placeholders in paragraph blocks.
no-repository-exercises-found-for-course: No repository exercises found for course
open-saved-page-in-new-tab: Open saved page in a new tab
outdated-blocks-migrated-explanation: {{num}} blocks were created with an older version of the editor and they had to be migrated to a new format. Save the page to persist the changes.
pages-in-chapter-placeholder-explanation: This block is placed on each chapter front page, e.g. /chapter-1/ for navigating to different sub sections easily.
partners-block-description: Partners block is use to display all partner's logo in the landing page
peer-review-disabled-for-locking-chapter: Peer and self review are disabled for chapters with exercises done through locking enabled.
peer-reviews-to-receive-and-give-error-m: Peer reviews to give must be greater than peer reviews to receive
placeholder-code-description: A one-time code used for verification, such as password reset or email verification.
placeholder-reset-link-description: The password reset link that users can click to reset their password.
research-form-checkbox-description: This block is used to add a question to the research form.
revealable-content-explanation: This block has normal content and a button that the student can click to reveal the hidden extra content
table-box-description: This is a custom table block with colored background
template-name-helper-text: This template requires the following placeholders: {{placeholders}}. Make sure to include them in paragraph blocks within the email content.
template-name-helper-text-generic: The template name identifies this email template. Some template names support placeholders that will be replaced when emails are sent.
template-type-helper-text: This template type requires the following placeholders: {{placeholders}}. Make sure to include them in paragraph blocks within the email content.
template-type-helper-text-generic: The template type identifies this email template. Some template types support placeholders that will be replaced when emails are sent.
top-level-block-placeholder-explanation: This block list all the top level pages in a course and it is placed on the course material front page.
unsupported-block-placeholder-explanatio: This block is used as placeholder for blocks that are unsupported.
upload-error-unknown: An unknown error occurred while uploading the image. Please try again.
upload-or-drag-and-drop-onto-this-block: Upload or drag and drop onto this block
use-course-default-peer-review-config: Use course default peer review config
warning-mobile-background-missing: Warning: No mobile or larger background image is set, but other screen sizes have background images configured. The mobile background image serves as the default fallback for all screen sizes. If you want to use only one image that would be displayed on all screen sizes, upload it to the mobile background or larger image field.
warning-points-are-all-or-nothing-disabl: Warning: It is recommended to enable "points are all or nothing". The peer reviews given by students vary greatly in quality, which may lead to some students receiving unfair points from the exercise. Enabling this option reduces randomness in the received points, making the peer review process fairer for the students.
